title: ‘Fantastic Four’ Fails to Wow
text:
Media & Marketing ‘Fantastic Four’ Fails to Wow The summer’s latest superhero offering suffers from bad press, reviews as it takes No. 2 box-office spot By erich.schwartzel@wsj.com Updated Aug. 9, 2015 7:51 p.m. ET 
“Fantastic Four” opened with a disappointing $26.2 million, highlighting a less-than-fantastic weekend in an otherwise banner summer for big-budget Hollywood movies. Analysts had been expecting an opening of about $40 million—and even considered that weak for a film with franchise potential that cost about $120 million to produce. 
Instead, “Mission: Impossible—Rogue Nation” maintained the top spot at the box office. It grossed an... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Popular on WSJ
